alert.note: Alert for Bossier; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 13 at 9:28PM CDT until June 14 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LAFAYETTE AND SOUTHWESTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES... NORTHWESTERN WEBSTER AND NORTH CENTRAL BOSSIER PARISHES... At 928 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Springhill, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Springhill, Cullen, Taylor, Shongaloo, Welcome, State Line, Horsehead and Walkerville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
